SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
EINSTEIN GENERATIVE AI
Copilot Action: Send Meeting Request

Creates an email draft to request a meeting with the recipient, with three possible time slots or a link to the sender’s calendar for scheduling the meeting.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS
Available in: Lightning Experience
Available in: Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited Editions with the Einstein for Sales add-on


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To execute actions in Einstein Copilot:	Use Einstein Copilot for Salesforce
To use Send Meeting Request:	

Send Meeting Request

AND

Inbox Without Einstein Activity Capture


To run prompt templates:	Execute Prompt Templates
Action Details
API Name	SendMeetingRequest
Action Type	Standard
Reference Action Type	Standard Action
Reference Action	

Send Meeting Request

(sendMeetingRequest)


Inputs	recordID, userInput, startTime
Outputs	generatedEmail
Does this action execute one or more prompt templates?	Yes
Examples of Utterances That Trigger This Action
“Book a meeting with John Smith on July 10, 2024 to explore additional product offerings.”
“Send my meeting calendar to John Smith.”
"Schedule a meeting with John Smith.”
Considerations
After the email is sent, the recipient can click one of the options to immediately book a slot. If your calendar fills up in the meantime, the recipient sees only the times that the sender is still available.
A user can’t send an email directly from the Einstein panel. They can open the draft in the Salesforce email composer or select Copy to paste it into a client of their choosing.
In the email composer, the user can add other recipients to the meeting request email. However, they can’t select a time slot to schedule the meeting. 
In the email composer, if the user replaces the original recipient that was provided through the copilot action utterance, the meeting slots and calendar link are automatically removed from the email draft.
